pullRequest.title: feat: eventarc generic and eventarc other brushup
pullRequest.bodyText:
feat: eventarc generic and eventarc other brushup

Removes Pub/Sub POJO from CAL events
Adds eventarc/generic sample, which logs the HTTP request minus the Authorization header.
Minor cleanup such as fixing region tags
Does not attempt to remove run from existing Eventarc sample namespacing.

commit.message:
feat: eventarc generic and eventarc other brushup

Signed-off-by: Grant Timmerman <timmerman+devrel@google.com>

lint: fix lint issue

Signed-off-by: Grant Timmerman <timmerman+devrel@google.com>

lint: fix lint issue

Signed-off-by: Grant Timmerman <timmerman+devrel@google.com>

nodes.bodyText: Even though this isn't the point of the sample, removing PubSubBody feels like it makes this sample not useful for continued learning and building.
Is this for a quickstart? I don't want us to keep using Dockerfiles for these samples

nodes.bodyText: Users may confused what a CloudEvent is here. Maybe add a link or more explanation.

+# Cloud Eventarc - Generic tutorial

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+# Cloud Eventarc - Generic tutorial
+
+This sample shows how to create a service that processes generic CloudEvents.
+
+For more details on how to work with this sample read the [Google Cloud Run Java Samples README](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/java-docs-samples/tree/master/run).
+
+[![Run in Google Cloud][run_img]][run_link]
+
+[run_img]: https://storage.googleapis.com/cloudrun/button.svg
+[run_link]: https://deploy.cloud.run/?git_repo=https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/java-docs-samples&dir=run/events-generic
+
+
+## Dependencies
+
+* **Spring Boot**: Web server framework.
+* **Jib**: Container build tool.
+* **Junit + SpringBootTest**: [development] Test running framework.
+* **MockMVC**: [development] Integration testing support framework.
+
+## Quickstart
+
+Use the [Jib Maven Plugin](https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/jib/tree/master/jib-maven-plugin) to build and push your container image:
+
+```sh
+mvn jib:build -Dimage gcr.io/$(gcloud config get-value project)/eventarc-generic
+```
+
+Deploy your Cloud Run service:
+
+```sh
+gcloud run deploy eventarc-generic \
+--image gcr.io/$(gcloud config get-value project)/eventarc-generic
+```
+
+## Test
+
+Test your Cloud Run service by sending CloudEvents: 
+
+```sh
+curl -XPOST $CLOUD_RUN_URL \
+-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
+-H "ce-id: 1413058901901494" \
+-H "ce-source: //books.googleapis.com/book/MY-BOOK" \
+-H "ce-specversion: 1.0" \
+-H "ce-type: my-type" \
+-d '{"key": "value"}'
+```
+
+You may observe the Run service receiving an event in Cloud Logging.

+Test your Cloud Run service by sending CloudEvents:

+```sh
+curl -XPOST $CLOUD_RUN_URL \

commit.message:
fix: eventarc generic review comments

Signed-off-by: Grant Timmerman <timmerman+devrel@google.com>

nodes.bodyText:
This sample literally does not receive Pub/Sub requests. It receives Cloud Audit Log requests. In this case, the audit log is for a Cloud Storage event.
Thus, it's incorrect to have Pub/Sub in this sample. The sample does not use this body, so the tests have always passed. If we wanted a different POJO, we cannot include a LogEntryData POJO until that library is finished and published.
We have a Pub/Sub sample for Pub/Sub events.

nodes.bodyText:
Added a link.
In general, we're trying to reduce the amount of duplicate instructions between CloudSite and the docs, so we might remove this README in the future like we do with functions/.

nodes.bodyText: I forgot the fields aren't necessary strings, so this should be <String, Object> for the unmarshalling. Will approve for this simple change.

commit.message:
fix: eventarc audit map from string to object

Signed-off-by: Grant Timmerman <timmerman+devrel@google.com>
